job_title: Administration Manager in Newport News, VA
pros: Paid Time Off and Sick Leave
cons: Cut throat organization. You are not valued after you have been there a long time - it’s just the opposite, you become a financial liability and they will get rid of you to save money by bringing in younger, newer people for less money. Forget any ideas RHS is a “Great Place To Work” and you will retire there. They don’t value your tenure. Out of thousands of employees just look and see how many are still there long enough to retire. The first several years I worked there I was 100% pro Riverside and just thought the grumblings of older employees were just sour grapes. I feel like a fool now. I was used and discarded.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: Some of the offices are very good.  Some of the people are extremely friendly and are more than willing to show you the ropes and train you properly when you come in for the 1st time.  Also, the environment for some of the offices is very nice, none stressful and the doctors are very nice.
cons: Riverside prides themselves of being family oriented when it comes to their employees, but they are not.  When and if one of your children get sick on the same day that you have to show for work, they get extremely mean like is your fault that your child is ill and demand that you show up for work or face the consequences.  Some of the Office Managers, specially for Neurology are stuck up, very mean and love to throw in people faces their title on the employees faces.  There is racism in some of the offices as well, and as such one feels very uncomfortable working in that type of environment.

job_title: Social Worker in Tappahannock, VA
pros: Good benefits And caring people
cons: Little to no increase in salary

job_title: Unit Secretary in Newport News, VA
pros: Competitive salaries, decent benefits, mission and vision driven.
cons: I have no cons to offer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: The people are friendly and I've had plenty of opportunity for career development.  Leadership team is accessible (in my area) and open communicate.  Hours are flexible, great work/life balance.
cons: Sometimes it seems that the people who work the hardest get the least while other nonproductive people advance quicker in the organization.  The pay isn't competitive compared to other organizations in this area.   It also seems that there are a lot of ideas but it takes so long for something to be implemented.  There needs to be a culture change because a lot of people have been in their positions for a very long time but aren't effective.  We operate in silos so no one communicates across divisions.  There are some people in the organization who look out for themselves instead of what's best for the organization so there are bad decisions made.  Also the recruitment process is very lengthy (especially for internal applicants) so we lose out on great prospects because the turnaround time is so long.

review_title: unfair place to work and racism and bullying runs rampant
job_title: Registered Nurse in Gloucester, VA
pros: enjoyed working 12hr shifts. it gave me more time to do things I needed or wanted to do
cons: the management and HR department within the Gloucester hospital are very unprofessional. They have been there so long that when unfair situations arise, no need to go through the chain of command because they take up for one another. some floor nurses who have been there a while and some management in Gloucester are related and therefore when new comers are mistreated it falls on deaf ears. the old floor nurses bully the new nurses and mistreat them and I had racist comments made towards me. when I reported the issue to the manager, I was told that she has worked with those workers for a long time and did not believe the incident took place and therefore she would not investigate the problem. it was very frustrating and very stressful working at this location. this location really need to get new management and shake things up a little. bill downing never returned my phone calls

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: Riverside Regional : The staff and your coworkers are family.  The floor nurses are impeccable when it comes to being on the front line.
cons: Consistent with lack of communication and no regard with the CNAs and Nurses on certain Units. They expect us to come in early to prepare the floor yet complain when we clock in too early... then don't care when the doctor requires bed rest that falls over the time the whole unit shuts down at 6:30 since there's no night shift. Not to mention over booking the unit when we only have 8 rooms to utilize. It took 5 years for a particular unit to get a break room. Also you only qualify for health insurance if you work over 30 hours a week.

review_title: Tired of feeling like a number.   They take overworked and underpayed to a new level!!!!
job_title: Registered Nurse in Newport News, VA
pros: Majority of staff in whole hospital nice.  Some ICU and a lot of OR staff not so nice.   Endoscopy staff is awesome!!!   Really only pro to this hospital is putting on your résumé that you worked here because it is a trauma facility.....Whoopdie do!!!!
cons: They say pay here is competitive.....WRONG!!!  Mary Immaculate and Sentara Careplex pay 4-5 bucks more/hr.  The call schedule is awful in the Endoscopy Dept and not everyone in dept takes call.  Not fair!!!  Why should FT staff get screwed while PT staff doesn't have to do it??

job_title: Food Tech in Hampton, VA
pros: alot of the co-workers are great, enjoy helping customers, great experience with different clients.
cons: some more profeessional staff l;ook down on other staff with less tech knownledge.persons of authority have too power over co-workers. can't understand why (hr) and higher personnel allow one sex staff to work all weekends and only one weekend every two months unless he quest it. and get one weekend day and weekday off , every one else gets weekends off unless something comes up. if you compliant you get treated wrong.

review_title: Great Ideas but that's all they seem to be..Ideas
job_title: UCP/CNA in Richmond, VA
pros: What they are doing for the elderly is just what they need.  At the building I work at they work with your scheduled and while things are uncertain at the moment it is hassle free when you need to request time off.
cons: Communication is bad. usually your clients end up finding out things before you do.  unorganized and weak structure.  you cold get a manager that listens and let you know what they can or cant do or you can get one who acts like they listen to get you out of there office.. its a 50/50 shot, its a shame the way they lose good people that could potentially keep the company afloat.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: It’s so sad to say but there are not any pros about this company. Each facility is different and there is a possibility to meet some awesome people but the health system overall needs help.
cons: This company is not innovative AT ALL. Their competitors are leaving them in dust especially when it comes to technology, employee retention & appreciation. If you want to be overworked, underpaid and not have work-life balance, then this is the place for you.

review_title: Committed to Continued Improvement and Growth
job_title: in Raleigh, NC
pros: This organization is dedicated to continual improvement of processes. In my time at Riverside, I have had a lot of opportunities to grow and learn, as well as offer feedback in multiple areas of the organization. There is a lot of teamwork and collaboration among employees throughout the entire organization. You feel like you are impacting lives around you, and that to me is extremely powerful. If you are passionate about impacting lives and truly making a difference, this is the organization for you.
cons: Overall, I think there are a lot of good ideas and suggestions. However, in terms of implementing them, there needs to be more follow through and upkeep.

job_title: Recruitment Specialist in Raleigh, NC
pros: Nothing except the fact that I could say that I had a job and it brought me income. Some people were friendly but most were putting on fronts
cons: Salary is awful, "not my job" mentality, everything else about the organization is terrible. They put people into management positions that don't deserve it and don't know what they're doing and successfully run an entire department into the ground

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Newport News, VA
pros: I have worked at Riverside Regional Medical Center for almost 6 years now. I have enjoyed having so many learning opportunities through the health system. Many companies do not give that opportunity or assist with tuition assistance. The medical benefits have been great especially getting a Riverside employee discount. I love what I do and can see myself her for a long time.
cons: I feel as we grow many folks fill over worked and unappreciated.  I hope that some way we can make this better so we have happier employees.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse  in Hampton, VA
pros: It is stable employment in an uncertain economy. If work is slow in one area and it is neccessary to reduce staff, ths staff will be moved into another area, preventing layoffs. If you are ready for a change, there are numerous areas to be moved into under the Riverside umbrella. This prevents changing 401K's etc, as would happen with leaving one company for another. The staff is friendly and helpful to new employees. Riverside has educational assistance.
cons: There are occasions when my work load just does not fit into a 40 hour work week.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros:
1) Excellent community partner
2) Beautiful facilities
3) Strong investment in technology
4) Some internal departments and teams have a strong sense of family
cons:
1) Company's clinical operations are operate effectively across entities however the company's administrative / back-office operations are extremely siloed.
2) Poor investment in continuing education and staff development (in comparison to competition)
3) Consistently on the lower end of the pay-scale compared to major competitors in the market
4) Slow to react to market changes, rarely an early adopter or first to market (always a follower)

review_title: Very unpleasant people to work with, no team work!
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros: A great place to get a start in a hospital setting and the benefits are okay.
cons: No team work at all. This company really doesn't care about your family problems nor if your sick as long as you show up to work. Employees are always angry because they don't get paid enough.

job_title: CNA in Hampton, VA
pros: Works with my school schedule. Yearly pay raise based on performance.
cons: The facility I work for gives too many crappy employees too many strikes. Lets them come in to work late all the time and they never got reprimanded. Too many Aides treat the work like work and don't care about patient care. Management needs to stop being friends and letting those certain employees get away with so much and have the wool pulled over their eyes while they do whatever they want at the patients cost. So many staff has no respect.

job_title: Medical Administrative Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros:
Decent pay, but could be higher, given the pay rates of nearby hospital systems. 
They claim to be competitive, however after speaking with others who I know that work for other local facilities, I have found that RHG pays under what Sentara or Bon Secours pays their employees with the same skill level.
cons: Hard to move within the company. Feel very under appreciated, and easily replaceable. Company is quick to throw employee under the bus, instead of trying to assist an employee.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: I absolutely love working for a place that truly puts the patient first. I see employees practicing the Care Difference daily, and it makes my heart happy to be a part of it. They also are very active in the community, which is so important.
cons: Pay is low in comparison, but Riverside is constantly doing reviews to try and fix that issue

review_title: It is a very rewarding experience being able to float between the different offices.
job_title: Office Associate- Float Pool in Newport News, VA
pros: It challenges me daily, due to each office performs the same functions differently. I am able to receive a taste of the different medical fields available on the chance a permanent position becomes available.
cons: I am not guaranteed 40 hrs a week and the travel can become tedious. I am uncomfortable not knowing the protocols for the office and fear of making mistakes causes me much turmoil.

review_title: I had a great experience working as a part time life guard at Riverside.
job_title: LIfe Guard in Gloucester, VA
pros: Pros are, I received on the spot training, and became certified as a lifeguard as a part of the hiring process. Also, being a team member of Riverside Health Systems gives you access to all of Riverside's gyms and facilities.
cons: The only cons I see in this position are weak compensation for life guards, being slightly underpaid compared to our competitors who received $9+ per hour to guard.

review_title: Its an OK place to work
job_title: in Newport News, VA
pros: They do hire a lot of new people but also have a lot of people with experience to help train
cons: Like any hospital or medical facility it seems like we are always short handed on most of our shifts, this creates a lot of stress and unfortunately sometimes errors.

review_title: Loved the atmosphere while I was there. Fun place to work and your work helps to better people's lives (or save a life!)
job_title: Unit Secretary in Gloucester, VA
pros:
Meaningful job. Interesting work. Decent pay. Yearly review/raise. 
Differential pay for working nights or weekends. My base pay was only $10.25.
cons: It was hard to fit in at first. I've noticed when there are new employees other "old" employees give them the cold shoulder until you earn their respect.

job_title: Clinical in Newport News, VA
pros: -It mission to the the poor and people who are underserved medically.   The community (local) traditionally has had a positive attachment to hospital, though that connection has weakened.
cons: -No longer run like a non-profit, very physician centered, administration no longer interested in providing a great environment to work.  Think of the air traffic controller's strike at the start of the 80's and the effect that had on employee and employer relations, a similair thing has happen at Riverside.

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Smithfield, VA
pros: Wonderful onboarding experience and great company overall. great benefits for full-time and overall company culture.
cons: Specific location had very difficult coworkers who refused to share team computers. When this was brought to management's attention, it was not resolved. Spoke with HR to request change in location, but acting manager would have to be involved, so not worth it. HR very willing to assist with concerns but employee felt this would create more turmoil and remove confidential concerns. Therapist gave notice instead

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: Caring employees and staff, great company culture. You truly feel like you are apart of a family with Riverside. The employees go above and beyond with little recognization by leadership.
cons: Hiring freezes, department downsizing, hard to transfer to an advanced role

job_title: Registered Nurse in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Nurse Residency program, Pay incentives, Self-scheduling
cons: Poor management support to further career.

review_title: Not my favorite job, not the worst either.
job_title: Transcriptionist in Newport News, VA
pros: Work from home, easy to get time off when needed, overtime usually available.
cons: When suggestions were made on how to improve productivity and efficiency they were ignored.  Improve as in cut the time needed to do the job in HALF.  Silliness.

job_title: Manager in Newport News, VA
pros: Decent benefits and frontline and clinical staff all a pleasure to work with.
cons: Too top heavy and leadership is not accessible.  It is a 'do as I say, not as I do' culture.  Corporate positions constantly created, but staff caring for patients are always short handed, especially a lack of CNAs.  Work life balance depends on who your manager or director is.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Gloucester, VA
pros: My co-workers are great.
cons: Management, supervisors, charge nurses, etc. need to be educated on how to help nurses on the floor and get out of their offices!

review_title: Dysfunctional...Some people get away with murder
job_title: Telemetry Technician in Newport News, VA
pros: I really liked the updated tele room you and one other tech have a decent size space your own restroom in your office space mini fridge microwave also if you have absolutely no experience in telemetry this department will train you it is a good way to get the experience of 6months most other places require you to do tele monitoring the hospital offers payroll deductable for meals and uniforms uniform store right in hospital that is always convenient they are trying to expand that is also always good and dandy timeclock inside your office another plus and tuition assistance available to you on your first day no waiting period to be eligible so that was neat...I’m trying to be fair before I go to the cons
cons: Department has a shortage no prn flexi people to fill in the hole or pick up so you end up in a room with a nurse that might have never even set foot in a tele room and has no idea but they fill in techs do not get their breaks if management is busy you cannot leave the room and have you coworker keep an eye on your station like how nurses go to lunch and other nurses keep an eye on their patients this is the first tele department I have worked in that implanted this rule if you get sick on the job and no one can come in to cover you Angela will write you up even though hospital policy does not allow you to be there if you are seriously ill i.e. vomiting the strips are redundant after you do your first set of strips you continue to chart every four hours if it’s Sinus Rhythm you chart that every four hours measurements included. You end up doing some much busy work it’s easy for you to get lost in the chart work versus keeping an eye out for arrhythmia changes. They have their favorites and that is never conducive to setting an ethical and professional work environment. Everyone shares their stories of why they didn’t show up to work and to hear this person say they had a headache so they called out and management is aware but no action was taken. Just be prepared to deal with unfair treatment. Also this is the lowest paying telemetry tech position I have worked. I took the job because the proximity to my home but if you are looking for decent pay and better treatment holter monitoring really anything across the water because trust me when I tell you it just is not worth it.

job_title: IT Manager in Newport News, VA
pros: Close knit, 'family' type of employer despite being a substantially size regional employer.
cons: Business units are granted more latitude to act than they probably should have.  Many projects that require the same resources during the same time windows.  Almost no central project/program management.

job_title: LIfe Guard in Gloucester, VA
pros: This job is good for a high school aged student that is looking for flexible hours and relatively easy job responsibilities
cons: The management was not up to par. Scheduling was always a problem and sometimes Lifeguards would not show up to their shifts on time without consequences.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Williamsburg, VA
pros: Small atmosphere, always approved for vacation
cons: Pay is lower than other places, health benefits are expensive, seems to be communication issues between departments.

review_title: great employer with good management, pay isn't competitive
job_title: EEG Technician in Newport News, VA
pros: Coworkers, flexible schedule, good benefits, good management that are responsive, autonomy, good amount of PTO and sick leave. They have a Starbucks in the main hospital. Call pay
cons: There weren't too many cons other than the pay, it's not competitive for the area. Have to take ALOT of call to make up for the low pay.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Williamsburg, VA
pros: Great place to  meet new people and get your foot in the door into the healthcare world. Helping you get certifications and new skills to advance your life and well being.
cons: Crazy hectic days with minimal help at times. No slack is picked up by the other co workers at times. And you often work to the beat of your own drum.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Gloucester, VA
pros: Riverside lives up to its mission statement. The staff and management strive to provide exceptional care and support to all customers. Riverside team members truly care about their patients and family members. Team members also care for each other. Working at Riverside makes you feel like a part of a big family.
cons: There are no cons that I wish to share regarding Riverside.

job_title: in Newport News, VA
pros: My boss is very flexible and I love my co workers. I can make my own schedule. You can learn a lot working here. Good shift differential pay. They pay for your schooling.
cons: The pay is not the best. They are the lowest paying hospital and the raises aren't great.

job_title: Physician in Newport News, VA
pros:
Steady Job
Lots of patients
Fair distribution of workload
Good sub specialists 
Fair schedule
cons:
No advancement potential unless you are in the old boys club
No control over group or contract-either my way or the highway
Infrequent raises
Terrible EMR
No Free Lunch or Breakfast
Long hours even after shift is over
Poor office support
Poor group leadership

job_title: Secretary in Newport News, VA
pros: Great place to work and be thankful that u have a job but every dept is understaffed which leaves everyone working to the dirty bone neglecting patient care
cons: Gave it in the pro. The only thing is the people but they too are always complaining

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: Some of the nicest people you could ever work with. They make you feel like part of the family.
cons: Some leadership has been promoted over the years, but not based on their ability to do their job.

review_title: Not what I thought it would be.
job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Newport News, VA
pros: Good hospital to learn in.  In general doctors & staff are pleasant to deal with.
cons: Management does not care.  Confidentiality is an issue.  Lowest salaries in the area.  Religions & races are not treated equally.

job_title: CNA in Warsaw, VA
pros: I left to work closer to home . The new job is an eye opening contrast ...i have already replied for my old job with RHS. Didn't know what I had till I left ..
cons: Pay a little low ..but over all feel and respect for employees is well worth it

job_title: Stock Room Tech in Newport News, VA
pros: Great food at great prices (at my hospital anyways,) friendly environment( mostly,) chances for overtime are plenty as well.
cons: Pay is low starting out possibly due to the type of business the hospital is in, but kind of makes up for it with the pay differentials. Nothing else comes to mind except their stocking system is very outdated.

job_title: Environmental Services in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Good coworkers, good residents,
cons: Management, pay, flexibility with hours, and no higher level participation from higher heads

review_title: The good, the bad, and the ugly
job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Chicago, IL
pros: Many years of great experience.
cons: Back stabbers and lazy employees disinterested in patient care- just a paycheck. To each his own within each department... where is the teamwork??? What is accountability?

job_title: Patien Service Representative
pros: The company does treats doctors well, and PTO is nice. You get about 6 hours a pay period. Nacho bar on Tuesdays is the best part
cons: Treats everyone else not so well. Highly understaffed. Communication between departments does not exist. Pay is low for needed areas and high for unneeded areas

job_title: in Moreno Valley, CA
pros: The atmosphere and people.  Most everyone who is there likes the work that they do.  Management is serious about listening to their employees and trying to make work life better for their employees.
cons: There is nothing that I can think of at this time.

job_title: Clinical Nurse Educator in Newport News, VA
pros:
Opportunity for growth
Staff are really trying to work together
Looking for ways to do care that is more efficient
cons:
Top heavy
Communication between administration and bedside staff lacking
Decisions being made without thought to how it effects the whole or the community.

job_title: Marketing Associate in Newport News, VA
pros: I'm proud to be at Riverside because of how we care for and support our communities. Working here feels like you are part of a family.
cons: We consistently work to take in feedback and make improvements. We view issues as opportunities to get better.

review_title: Good experience, not so good people.
job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Chesapeake, VA
pros: Great experience working with patients. You'll never be bored and learn a lot.
cons: Clique-y coworkers. Not open to teaching new staff. Co-workers rarely show any passion for their jobs or for patient care. Scheduling issues. Low compensation for the amount of work you have to do.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Newport News, VA
pros: Great company to work for. Good principles steady work competent staff.
cons: Pay could be better, but unsure of the other medical groups in the area salary ranges. Private sector pay is better but that is to be expected.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Newport News, VA
pros: Riverside takes time to teach new staff very well to succeed at delivering great care.
cons: Staffing/resource shortages frequently occur due to the high volume of patients seeking care.

job_title: Technical Support in Newport News, VA
pros: Everyone who works here is very friendly and they want you to succeed. Definitely felt welcomed. They also like to hire from within, which is very helpful if you are looking for a place to work long-term.
cons: So far, I have not encountered any cons

job_title: Registered Nurse in Warsaw, VA
pros: High standards of patient care
cons: Poor corporate and administrative leadership

job_title: Senior Executive Secretary in Newport News, VA
pros: Departments worked well together and I truly enjoyed my coworkers. The focus remains the patient, no matter the situation.
cons: Workload was stressful. I don't know how I lasted as long as I did.

review_title: Average large health care company to work for
job_title: STaff Registered Nurse in Newport News, VA
pros: Nice people, good opportunities. Pleasant environment.
cons: Always crying poormouth,  very small raise,  Try to make up for budget shortfalls by taking it out on employees.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse Mentor in Hampton, VA
pros: Customer service is a top priority. They are true to their mission statement with treating others as they would treat their family members.
cons: Administration is not always supportive.

job_title: Lead Tech for Support Services Lab in Newport News, VA
pros: My supervisor cared about me as a person and there were lots of benefits.
cons: We had some people who abused the fmla policy. Made it difficult to work short staffed.

review_title: Good to gain experience as a new CNA
job_title: CNA in Hampton, VA
pros: Great learning experience for anyone who has never worked as a CNA before

job_title: Sales in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Good Benefits - except health insurance
cons: Health insurance is only good if you use Riverside providers. Corporate executives who earn the big money can be clueless. Raises a ridiculously small.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Williamsburg, VA
pros: Great Benefits, Awesome co-workers, Overtime. Recommends this company to a friend, but don't do a LTC facility.
cons: Nurse to patient ratio 1:25, impossible to every finish your shift on time, not easy to transfer from one facility to another facility within organization.

job_title: Med Administrative in Newport News, VA
pros: Very few good people &  doctors.
cons: Not family oriented at all. No room for advancement. Company as a whole cares more about profit than healthcare. The majority of the managers are extremely racist.

review_title: Need to treat their employees better.
job_title: Senior Accountant in Newport News, VA
pros: Very good benefits if you stick with their tier 1 package
cons: Long hours. They work their good employees to death. They need to hire more help

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Newport News, VA
pros: I was not mirco-managed. I had multiple duties which I enjoyed because I was always busy. I was free to learn new thing about the department I worked in
cons: Riverside Health System does not take care of their dedicated employees. Those that do nothing seem to get away with doing nothing. Those that actually work hard are punished with more work

review_title: CNA to get experience before nursing school
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Newport News, VA

review_title: Great culture and nice people to work with.
job_title: Analyst in Newport News, VA

job_title: in Newport News, VA

job_title: Office Assistant in Newport News, VA

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Williamsburg, VA
pros: Excellent place to work, the manager at my location was incredibly supportive and encouraged growth.

review_title: I have the opportunity to help the community

review_title: Rude, and lack of care from staff
job_title: CNA in Saluda, VA

cons: The lack of care that staff give to patients is ridiculous, I came from a well ran nursing home before walking into that place they call a so called nursing home. Staff is rude to patients and to each other.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Newport News, VA

job_title: GI Registered Nurse in Newport News, VA

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Chesapeake, VA
